subject: Business
title: Resilience: Bouncing Back From Failure
description: Learn Resilience: Bouncing Back From Failure in one minute.

hook.text: Steve Jobs was fired from the company he founded. He came back 12 years later and built it into the most valuable.

buildup.text: Resilience isn't avoiding failure. It's the ability to recover, learn, and come back stronger.

discovery.text: Research shows resilient leaders share three traits: they accept reality, find meaning in hardship, and improvise.

twist.text: Toxic positivity â€” 'Everything happens for a reason!' â€” isn't resilience. Real resilience acknowledges pain first.

climax.text: Jobs said being fired was the best thing that happened to him. It freed him to be creative again.

punchline.text: Failure isn't fatal. But refusing to learn from it is.

quiz.question: What three traits do resilient leaders share?
options: They accept reality, find meaning in hardship, and improvise
They deny failure, stay optimistic, and move on quickly
They blame others, reduce risk, and avoid change
